answers.answer: This something I would call and mention to my OB tomorrow if I were you...excessive thirst can indicate diabetes. I wouldn't worry TOO Much because it can also be normal to be more thirsty - your body is trying to build up a higher blood volume by the way, after all! but definitely something to call and ask about :-)
a higher blood volume by the DAY not way, lol*
Lol I drink roughly 3-4 liters of water a day!  If I drink any more I might suffer hyperhydrosis!
I agree with ashelen, I'm gestational diabetes found out just recently I get super super thirsty. Im now Risk for preterm coz Too much amniotic fluid....Something u need to tell ur OB...

question: Ugh no matter how much, or what I drink (usually only water and milk), I am constantly thirsty!! And I have this earthy, metallic, dirty taste in my mouth constantly.   Almost like I have sand, or ashes in my throat too! Even after I brush my teeth!  I don't remember having this problem when I was pregnant last time :-P
title: So thirsty all the time!
